column1: At the gate of the Castle the Prince was waiting to receive her. He had dreamy violet eyes
column2: and his hair was like fine gold. When he saw her he sank upon one knee
column3: and kissed her hand."Your picture was beautiful
column4: he murmured, but you are more beautiful than your picture"; and the little Princess blushed."She was like a white rose before
column5: said a young Page to his neighbour, but she is like a red rose now"; and the whole Court was delighted.For the next three days everybody went about saying
column9: White rose"; and the King gave orders that the Page's salary was to be doubled. As he received no salary at all this was not of much use to him
column10: but it was considered a great honour
column11: and was duly published in the Court Gazette.When the three days were over the marriage was celebrated. It was a magnificent ceremony
column12: and the bride and bridegroom walked hand in hand under a canopy of purple velvet embroidered with little pearls.
